Alberta|I-LOC has|O a|O dry|O continental|O climate|O with|O warm|O summers|O and|O cold|O winters|O .|O

Alberta|I-LOC is|O a|O sunny|O province|O .|O

Albert|I-PER Einstein|I-PER ;|O 14|O March|O 1879|O --|O 18|O April|O 1955|O )|O was|O a|O theoretical|O physicist|O ,|O philosopher|O and|O author|O who|O is|O widely|O regarded|O as|O one|O of|O the|O most|O influential|O and|O best|O known|O scientists|O and|O intellectuals|O of|O all|O time|O .|O
Einstein|I-PER published|O more|O than|O 300|O scientific|O and|O over|O 150|O non-scientific|O works|O ;|O he|O additionally|O wrote|O and|O commentated|O prolifically|O on|O various|O philosophical|O and|O political|O subjects|O .|O
His|O great|O intelligence|O and|O originality|O has|O made|O the|O word|O "|O Einstein|I-PER "|O synonymous|O with|O genius|O .|O
His|O father|O was|O Hermann|I-PER Einstein|I-PER ,|O a|O salesman|O and|O engineer|O .|O
His|O mother|O was|O Pauline|I-PER Einstein|I-PER (|O née|O Koch|I-PER )|O .|O
Their|O son|O attended|O a|O Catholic|I-ORG elementary|I-ORG school|I-ORG from|O the|O age|O of|O five|O until|O ten|O .|O
Although|O Einstein|I-PER had|O early|O speech|O difficulties|O ,|O he|O was|O a|O top|O student|O in|O elementary|O school|O .|O
His|O father|O once|O showed|O him|O a|O pocket|O compass|O ;|O Einstein|I-PER realized|O that|O there|O must|O be|O something|O causing|O the|O needle|O to|O move|O ,|O despite|O the|O apparent|O "|O empty|O space|O .|O "|O

Armenia|I-LOC is|O the|O second|O most|O densely|O populated|O of|O the|O former|O Soviet|I-LOC republics|I-LOC .|O
It|O is|O situated|O between|O the|O Black|I-LOC Sea|I-LOC and|O the|O Caspian|I-LOC Sea|I-LOC ,|O bordered|O on|O the|O north|O and|O east|O by|O Georgia|I-LOC and|O Azerbaijan|I-LOC and|O on|O the|O south|O and|O west|O by|O Iran|I-LOC and|O Turkey|I-LOC .|O
Until|O independence|O ,|O Armenia|I-LOC 's|O economy|O was|O based|O largely|O on|O industry|O --|O chemicals|O ,|O electronic|O products|O ,|O machinery|O ,|O processed|O food|O ,|O synthetic|O rubber|O and|O textiles-and|O highly|O dependent|O on|O outside|O resources|O .|O

AES|I-MISC has|O a|O fixed|O block|O size|O of|O 128|O bits|O and|O a|O key|O size|O of|O 128|O ,|O 192|O ,|O or|O 256|O bits|O ,|O whereas|O Rijndael|I-MISC can|O be|O specified|O with|O block|O and|O key|O sizes|O in|O any|O multiple|O of|O 32|O bits|O ,|O with|O a|O minimum|O of|O 128|O bits|O .|O
AES|I-MISC operates|O on|O a|O 4×4|O array|O of|O bytes|O ,|O termed|O the|O state|O (|O versions|O of|O Rijndael|I-MISC with|O a|O larger|O block|O size|O have|O additional|O columns|O in|O the|O state|O )|O .|O
Most|O AES|I-MISC calculations|O are|O done|O in|O a|O special|O finite|O field|O .|O
The|O AES|I-MISC cipher|O is|O specified|O as|O a|O number|O of|O repetitions|O of|O transformation|O rounds|O that|O convert|O the|O input|O plaintext|O into|O the|O final|O output|O of|O ciphertext|O .|O
For|O AES|I-MISC ,|O the|O first|O row|O is|O left|O unchanged|O .|O
(|O Rijndael|I-MISC variants|O with|O a|O larger|O block|O size|O have|O slightly|O different|O offsets|O )|O .|O
In|O the|O case|O of|O the|O 256-bit|O block|O ,|O the|O first|O row|O is|O unchanged|O and|O the|O shifting|O for|O second|O ,|O third|O and|O fourth|O row|O is|O 1|O byte|O ,|O 3|O bytes|O and|O 4|O bytes|O respectively|O --|O this|O change|O only|O applies|O for|O the|O Rijndael|I-MISC cipher|O when|O used|O with|O a|O 256-bit|O block|O ,|O as|O AES|I-MISC does|O not|O use|O 256-bit|O blocks|O .|O
